page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY IN HAMBLEDON
page.content: Although cricket was played earlier in other parts of England,{Hambledon}has become known around the world as "the cradle of cricket" because of the success of its village club.Between the years 1772 and 1781,it won 29 of the 51 matches it played against England teams.The cricket was played on{Broad Halfpenny Down.}The players wore sky-blue coats,white shirts and breeches and gold laced tricorne hats. A curved bat was used and there were only two stumps at each end.Opposite the cricket ground stood the{Bat and {Ball Inn.}Its landlord was captain of the club and his decisions on the rules of cricket were accepted by the leading players of the day.Mementoes of the club are preserved at the{Bat {and Ball Inn.}Immediately opposite there is a granite obelisk inscribed with two bats,a ball and stumps.
